results.title: This is OpenAI CEO Sam Altman's favorite question about AGI
results.summary: Earlier this year, Sam Altman discussed the future of artificial general intelligence at Harvard. Altman said he envisions AGI as a tool to enhance productivity and create shared intelligence.
results.relevance: Directly addresses Altman's focus on AGI development and his vision for its societal benefits.

results.title: OpenAI's Sam Altman: AGI coming but is less impactful than we think
results.summary: OpenAI's Sam Altman suggests that while human-level AI is on the horizon, its impact may not be as transformative as widely anticipated.
results.relevance: Provides insights on Altman's perspectives on AGI, relevant to his goal of responsible AI development.

results.title: OpenAI CEO: We may have AI superintelligence in 'a few thousand days'
results.summary: Sam Altman's essay outlines his vision for a future with AI-driven progress and prosperity.
results.relevance: Aligns with Altman's ambition of rapidly building AGI and its implications for society.

results.title: Planning for AGI and beyond - OpenAI
results.summary: OpenAI outlines its strategic planning regarding the deployment and real-world operation of AGI systems.
results.relevance: Provides strategic insights into AGI development that align with Altman's goals.

results.summary: Highlights key points from Altman's talk on AGI, focusing on future models and necessary investments.
results.relevance: Directly ties into Altman's current goals in advancing AGI development.

results.title: Sam Altman's Eye-Scanning Orb Has a New Look and Will Come ... - WIRED
